intro: Pentaphorus fascicularis, commonly known as the clustered starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
